maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for retriving either a single Strava activity or all the Strava activies from your Strava account
This cmdlet can be used to retrieve a single Strava activity by the Activity Id, or you can retrieve all the activites from your account.
The Activity Id of a specific Strava Activity
Switch to define if you want to retrieve all the segment efforts you made on the specific Strava activity. This switch should be used combined with the Id parameter

Access token to authenticate with the Strava API. If you used the parameter switch -UseSecretStore when you run the cmdlet Set-StravaAuthentication. The access token is stored in the PowerShell secret store, and should not be provided to this cmdlet.
Switch parameter to define if the output from the command should be saved to a json file
If you defined the switch OutputJson, you can define a path to where the file should be stored. If no path is defined, the file will be saved in your current directory as ./strava_output.json

Access token to authenticate with the Strava API. If you used the parameter switch -UseSecretStore when you run the cmdlet Set-StravaAuthentication. The access token is stored in the PowerShell secret store, and should not be provided to this cmdlet.
You can define the Page number for the pagination when querying the Strava API by default it will start on page 1
You can define how many activities you want listed on each page queried from the Strava API

Access token to authenticate with the Strava API. If you used the parameter switch -UseSecretStore when you run the cmdlet Set-StravaAuthentication. The access token is stored in the PowerShell secret store, and should not be provided to this cmdlet.
The Activity Id of a specific Strava Activity
Switch to define if you want to retrieve all the segment efforts you made on the specific Strava activity. This switch should be used combined with the Id parameter
Switch parameter to define if the output from the command should be saved to a json file
If you defined the switch OutputJson, you can define a path to where the file should be stored. If no path is defined, the file will be saved in your current directory as ./strava_output.json
You can define the Page number for the pagination when querying the Strava API by default it will start on page 1
You can define how many activities you want listed on each page queried from the Strava API

Access token to authenticate with the Strava API. If you used the parameter switch -UseSecretStore when you run the cmdlet Set-StravaAuthentication. The access token is stored in the PowerShell secret store, and should not be provided to this cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will retrieve all the activities from your Strava account, and provide Verbose information
This example will retrieve all details on the specific Strava activity with the Id 1736127843
This example will save a json file with all the strava activies. It will store the file in the path "~/temp/activities_output.json"

maml:description.maml:para: Cmdlet for retrieving all comments on an activity
This cmdlet will return all the comments added to a Strava Activity. The cmdlet can output the result to a json file
The Activity Id of a specific Strava Activity
Switch parameter to define if the output from the command should be saved to a json file
If you defined the switch OutputJson, you can define a path to where the file should be stored. If no path is defined, the file will be saved in your current directory as ./strava_output.json
You can define the Page number for the pagination when querying the Strava API by default it will start on page 1
You can define how many activities you want listed on each page queried from the Strava API

Access token to authenticate with the Strava API. If you used the parameter switch -UseSecretStore when you run the cmdlet Set-StravaAuthentication. The access token is stored in the PowerShell secret store, and should not be provided to this cmdlet.
The Activity Id of a specific Strava Activity
Switch parameter to define if the output from the command should be saved to a json file
If you defined the switch OutputJson, you can define a path to where the file should be stored. If no path is defined, the file will be saved in your current directory as ./strava_output.json
You can define the Page number for the pagination when querying the Strava API by default it will start on page 1
You can define how many activities you want listed on each page queried from the Strava API

Access token to authenticate with the Strava API. If you used the parameter switch -UseSecretStore when you run the cmdlet Set-StravaAuthentication. The access token is stored in the PowerShell secret store, and should not be provided to this cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will output an object containing all the comments created on the spicific activity with the Id 7551294509
This example will output all the comments from an activity to a json file and create the file in the path ~/temp/strava_output.json

maml:description.maml:para: Function for setting up your strava authentication for the first time.
This function requires that you have alreaded create the API application in your Strava Account.

if you haven't already created a Strava API App you will need to go to url: https://www.strava.com/settings/api Once you have created the API App you should be able to find your API setting under: Strava profile --> Settings --> My API Application
Under the panel 'My API Application' you will be able to find: Client ID and Client Secret. These two values you will need to use for this function.

When you run the function, a web browser will be opened. Here you will be prompted to Authenticate your application. Once you've pressed the Authenticate button you will be redirected to a localhost page. On this page you will need to take the 'code' parameter in the URL.
It will look similar to: code=32e0113c8a5f7b704570349619c24fa567770e27 <-- You should not take the 'code=' part of the url. Only copy the code.
From this code you will generate a new refresh_token which will be used for every api call to authenticate to the API.

To save the client_id, client_secret & refresh_token, the function will install a new Secrets Vault named StravaSecrets. If you already have a vault canfigured it will use the password for this vaul, otherwise you will be prompted to create a new password. This password you will need to use everytime you run a strava command in a new PowerShell session.
This function should only be run the first time you want to use the PowerShell Module
The Client Id found on your Strava Account. Go to Settings --> My API Application --> Client ID
The Client Secret found on your Strava Account. Go to Settings --> My API Application --> Client Secret
{{ Fill UseSecretStore Description }}
The Client Id found on your Strava Account. Go to Settings --> My API Application --> Client ID
The Client Secret found on your Strava Account. Go to Settings --> My API Application --> Client Secret
{{ Fill UseSecretStore Description }}
